StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [UpdateApplicantNwaGUID]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @AcpPersonId uniqueiden..er = NULL, @NwaGUID uniqueiden..er = NULL ) AS
DECLARE @SSN varchar(9) DECLARE @AcpSSN varchar(11)
PRINT 'test'
IF(@NwaGUID IS NULL AND @AcpPersonId IS NOT NULL) BEGIN -- 'We have a @AcpPersonId, but not a @NwaGUID. Find the @NwaGUID using SSN'
SET @AcpSSN = (SELECT SSN FROM [ACP].[Person] WHERE PersonId = @AcpPersonId) SET @SSN = (SELECT REPLACE(@AcpSSN, '-', '')) SET @NwaGUID = (SELECT NwaGUID FROM [ACP].[EXT_MCRISS_NwaGUID] WHERE SSN = @SSN) END
IF(@AcpPersonId IS NULL AND @NwaGUID IS NOT NULL) BEGIN -- 'We have a @NwaGUID but not a @AcpPersonId, Find the @AcpPersonId using SSN'
SET @SSN = (SELECT SSN FROM [ACP].[EXT_MCRISS_NwaGUID] WHERE NwaGUID = @NwaGUID) SET @AcpSSN = (SUBSTRING(@SSN, 1, 3) + '-' + SUBSTRING(@SSN, 4, 2) + '-' + SUBSTRING(@SSN, 6, 4)) SET @AcpPersonId = (SELECT PersonId FROM [ACP].[Person] WHERE SSN = @AcpSSN) END
-- If we have both an @AcpPersonId and a @NwaGUID, update [ACP].[Applicant] IF(@AcpPersonId IS NOT NULL AND @NwaGUID IS NOT NULL) BEGIN UPDATE [ACP].[Applicant] SET NwaId = @NwaGUID WHERE PersonId = @AcpPersonId END
